core.compoundterm.primitiveterm
Class Trans

java.lang.Object
  core.compoundterm.CompoundTerm
      core.compoundterm.primitiveterm.PrimitiveTerm
          core.compoundterm.primitiveterm.Trans

public class Trans
extends PrimitiveTerm

Trans class implements signature mismatch primitive. There are occasions when a message to be exchanged between two components is functionally compatible yet syntactically inconsistent. Such a mismatch may be resolved by means of a translating primitive Trans. The signature mismatch primitive is semantically identical to message translator pattern included in EIP. Apache Camel supports the Message Translator from the EIP patterns by using an arbitrary Processor in the routing logic: in our case, we simply use the DSL (transform() method) into route definition. This involve that each input message is processed before to be sendend to receivers. How can happen message transformation? Users of this class must define transformation logic: with the definition of trans term, user specify how input message must be translated to be compatible with receiver. This is made through the definition of a new method having as parameter the expected message and as body the manipulation of his content. As you can see, information about this method, such as name and class container, must be used for trans definition.

Author:
giacomolm

Constructor Detail

Trans

public Trans(java.lang.String sourceUri,
             java.lang.Class in_type,
             java.lang.String receiverUri,
             java.lang.Class out_type)
Build new trans term, including base info such as source and receiver uri, and types expected from these uri.

Parameters:
sourceUri - term consumes message from this sourceUri
in_type - term is able to manage this type of input-message
receiverUri - term sends message to this receiverUri
out_type - type of the output message

receiverUri - term sends message to this receiverUri
out_type - type of the output message
method_class - Class of the method that manipulates input message
method_name - Name of the method manipulating input message

Parameters:
method_class - Class of the method that manipulates input message
method_name - Name (String) of the method manipulating input message

start

public void start()
Starts context associated the trans term. It simply add new route: consumes message from internal endpoint, transforms the message deleting incompatibility and sends the output message to receivers uri.

Overrides:
start in class PrimitiveTerm

setReceiver

public void setReceiver(java.lang.String receiver)
Set the receiver of output message

Parameters:
receiver - Endpoint receiving output message

setMessage

public void setMessage(java.lang.String uri,
                       org.apache.camel.Exchange e)
Set the Exchange e as input message of this trans term. This term check the equality of the uri received as parameter and source uri: if these two uri are the same, the method is forwarded to internal endpoint

Specified by:
setMessage in class CompoundTerm
Parameters:
uri - source of the exchange
e - exchange received
